The Tajik Ministry of Health sent a letter to the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and the country's tourism development committee, in which it asked departments to restrict both business and leisure trips of Tajik citizens to China.    The Deputy Minister of Health of Tajikistan noted that preventive work is being carried out in all regions of the country, laboratories are prepared for the on-line examination of citizens who arrived from China.    The deputy minister also added that the situation in Tajikistan remains stable so far, there have not been any cases of coronavirus among Tajik citizens, and all visitors from China are screened to identify signs of a dangerous disease. All airports are equipped with quarantine points.      Kamolzoda asked the Tajiks to refrain from flying to China for a while. According to him, "it is impossible to restrict the entry of citizens of other countries into our country," but, for security reasons, we will check all citizens coming from China, including Tajiks. "    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200529133937/https://regnum.ru/news/polit/2835826.html

The Khovar state news agency has reported that between February 1 and April 30, nearly 11,000 people have been placed in preventative quarantine. Of that total, 8,438 were discharged without showing signs of ill-health. More than 2,000 are still under observation.    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200528225850/https://eurasianet.org/tajikistan-finally-confirms-its-first-15-coronavirus-cases

Students, businessmen, Chinese citizens working in Tajikistan, who arrived from China, total 300 people, were quarantined for 14 days. However, they did not show signs of coronavirus. This was reported by the Ministry of Health and Social Protection of the Population of Tajikistan.    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200529133052/https://regnum.ru/news/society/2847860.html

In Tajikistan, a special headquarters began to work to counter the spread of coronavirus and was formed on behalf of President Emomali Rahmon.    The headquarters was formed from the heads of the ministries of health, education, agriculture, the ministry of foreign affairs,, youth, as well as the heads of TV and radio, airlines and airports of the country.    All decisions and recommendations of the headquarters must be implemented throughout Tajikistan.    According to the country's Ministry of Health, not a single case of coronavirus infection has been recorded in Tajikistan.    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200529132748/https://regnum.ru/news/society/2847875.html

According to Tajik Deputy Minister of Health Mirhamuddin Kamolzoda, only patients with signs of the virus will be tested. To date, none have been identified in the country.    Tajikistan received a large batch of Russian diagnostic tools, but the Ministry of Health plans to use them only in case of the appearance of primary signs of coronavirus.    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200529131935/https://regnum.ru/news/society/2849024.html

In connection with the spread of coronavirus in several Iranian cities, the Tajik authorities decided to suspend flights between the two countries.    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200529135405/https://regnum.ru/news/society/2866558.html

Tajikistan is taking additional measures to prevent the entry of a new type of coronavirus into the country. To do this, all citizens of Iran, South Korea and Japan will be quarantined for two weeks upon arrival in Tajikistan.    It is reported that this measure applies to all citizens of these countries, regardless of the country of arrival.    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200228152523/https://regnum.ru/news/polit/2869809.html

During the meeting chaired by President of the Republic Emomali Rahmon, the Minister of Health and Social Welfare Nasim Olimzoda delivered a report on measures taken to prevent the spread of coronavirus.  The minister’s report noted that among the citizens of the republic and other countries who arrived in Tajikistan in recent months,  there has not been a single case of coronavirus infection.    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200529134602/https://regnum.ru/news/society/2871459.html

Travel companies in Tajikistan should suspend the organization of tours. Such a recommendation was made by the tourism development committee under the government of the country, in a corresponding letter circulated to relevant organizations    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200529134357/https://regnum.ru/news/economy/2873955.html

Tajikistan notified local and foreign airlines that it would block the entry of citizens from a list of 35 countries which have had confirmed cases of the coronavirus. The countries include (with their number of confirmed cases as of March 3 in parentheses: China (80,151), South Korea (5,186), Italy (2,036), Iran (1,501), Japan (274), Spain (120), Singapore (108), United States (105), Kuwait (56), Bahrain (49), Thailand (43), Switzerland (42), the United Kingdom (40), Malaysia (36), Australia (31), Canada (27), Iraq (26), United Arab Emirates (21), Austria (18), Vietnam (16), Sweden (15), Lebanon (13), Israel (12), Croatia (9), Belgium (8), Finland (6),  Oman (6), Algeria (5), India (5), the Philippines (3), Egypt (2), Afghanistan (1), Cambodia (1), Nepal (1) and Sri Lanka (1).     Missing from the list, but with more than 100 cases, are France (191) and Germany (165). In addition, states in neighboring regions with recent cases like Georgia (3), Azerbaijan (3) and Armenia (1) are also not on the ban list, yet.    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200528130301/https://www.interfax.ru/world/697502

Higher and secondary educational institutions of Tajikistan will not be quarantined, Deputy Minister and Chief of Staff of the Ministry of Health and Social Welfare of Tajikistan for the Prevention of Coronavirus said at a press conference.    He noted that in schools, colleges and universities regular medical examinations of pupils and students are carried out, as well as consultations for parents.    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200528175712/https://tj.sputniknews.ru/main/20200305/1030827028/Tajikistan-mecheti-karantin-shkola-koronavirus.html

In Tajikistan, as of March 5, not a single case of coronavirus infection has been registered, Deputy Minister of Health and Social Welfare Mirhamuddin Kamolzoda said at a briefing.    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200529075559/https://tj.sputniknews.ru/country/20200305/1030824494/Kamolzoda-otmena-marshirovok-zakrytii-mechetey-tajikistan-koronavirus.html

Tajikistan strengthens anti-epidemic measures.      In accordance with the order of the President of Tajikistan dated March 18, 2020, in order to implement measures to prevent the spread of new coronavirus infection (COVID - 19), the Republican headquarters was established to strengthen anti-epidemic measures.    The management of the headquarters is entrusted to the Prime Minister of the Republic of Tajikistan Kohir Rasulzoda.    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200529124529/https://asiaplustj.info/ru/news/tajikistan/power/20200320/kohir-rasulzoda-vozglavil-novii-shtab-po-usileniyu-protivoepidemicheskih-meropriyatii

There are still no cases of infection with the new COVID-19 coronavirus in Tajikistan as announced by the Ministry of Health and Social Welfare.    The agency asks citizens to remain calm and not to believe the rumors about the appearance of coronavirus pneumonia in Tajikistan.    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200529125904/https://regnum.ru/news/polit/2889769.html

Tajik authorities have decided to close the state border with Kyrgyzstan. This was reported in the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Tajikistan.  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200326170051/https://regnum.ru/news/polit/2895218.html

As of March 25, 2020, 3,156 people are in quarantine zones in Tajikistan, of which 107 are foreigners, the country's Ministry of Health and Social Protection said.    According to the agency, 5 179 people who entered the territory of Tajikistan from February 1 to March 24, were quarantined in various medical institutions of the country. Of these, 2023 people were allowed to go home after necessary medical measures, while the rest remained in quarantine.    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200326170051/https://regnum.ru/news/polit/2895218.html

The Tajik authorities say that as part of measures to prevent the spread of coronavirus in the country, public transport and crowded places will now be disinfected.    According to official figures, as of March 28, there had not been a single case of coronavirus infection in Tajikistan, but authorities say that the strengthening of measures is due to the threat of the rapid spread of the virus around the world.    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200528233616/https://rus.ozodi.org/a/30515595.html

The Tajik government will not extend school holidays, which should end March 31. This was reported by the press service of the Ministry of Education of Tajikistan.    Thus, classes in Tajik schools will begin on April 1, 2020.    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200529092457/https://regnum.ru/news/polit/2899618.html

In Tajikistan, short-term and long-term visits to prisoners are temporarily suspended in all prisons. This was reported by the head of the Main Department of the Execution of Criminal Sentences of the Ministry of Justice of Tajikistan Mansurdzhon Umarov.    Measures were introduced by the government to prevent the spread of coronavirus in Tajikistan.    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200529091346/https://regnum.ru/news/polit/2902518.html

In the fight against coronavirus infection in Dushanbe, disinfection is carried out daily in public transport and minibuses.    Only after carrying out all the sanitation work do the vehicles enter the route. Outreach work is also being carried out among drivers.    Link:   https://web.archive.org/web/20200529090952/https://regnum.ru/news/economy/2908367.html

The Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of Tajikistan reports that temporary restrictions have been introduced on the entry and exit of all citizens of foreign countries and stateless persons through all checkpoints on the state borders of the Republic of Tajikistan.    These restrictions do not apply to diplomats of foreign states and representatives of international organizations and financial institutions, as well as members of their families accredited in the Republic of Tajikistan. In case of entry of the specified category of persons into the territory of the republic, the procedure of compulsory 14-day self-isolation in the places of their permanent residence under the supervision of employees of the Ministry of Health and Social Welfare of the Republic of Tajikistan is provided.    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200528130447/https://www.mfa.tj/ru/main/view/5919/vremennye-ogranicheniya-na-vezd-i-vyezd-inostrannykh-grazhdan-i-lits-bez-grazhdanstva-cherez-punkty-propuska-na-gosudarstvennoi-granitse-tadzhikistana

From February 1 to March 30, 6,159 Tajik citizens arrived in Tajikistan from abroad and were placed under 14-day quarantine by order of the country's Ministry of Health.    As of March 31, more than 4 thousand of them are in quarantine.      These measures were introduced by the government to prevent the spread of coronavirus.    After two weeks before discharge from quarantine, citizens must make an express test, which the Tajik authorities have received from the Russian Federation.    According to the country's Ministry of Health, there are still no cases of coronavirus infection in Tajikistan.     Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200529091937/https://regnum.ru/news/polit/2902407.html
Since April 18, mosques have been banned from conducting mass prayers and religious rites.    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200528180117/https://rus.ozodlik.org/a/30594031.html

Conventional outbreak of pneumonia: Tajikistan denies entry of coronavirus.    A sharp increase in the number of pneumonia cases in the country was explained in Tajikistan. According to the deputy head of the Ministry of Health and Social Welfare of the country, Shodihon Jamshed, the health of the country's citizens was greatly affected by weather conditions, which were rather unfavorable in recent days: snow, rain, a sharp wind, so “the number of respiratory diseases has risen sharply over the past few days , including pneumonia. "    The press service of the Ministry of Health noted that rumors circulated on the network that people who died from pneumonia were infected with coronavirus are unfounded and aimed at misinforming citizens.    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200529083710/https://regnum.ru/news/polit/2923790.html

On April 16, 2020, 2317 tests for coronavirus were carried out in Tajikistan, of which 440 were repeated. The results in all cases were negative, the press service of the Tajik Ministry of Health and Social Affairs said today, April 22.    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200520080641/https://regnum.ru/news/polit/2925380.html

First of all, those citizens who have pronounced symptoms of pneumonia are tested. They are also prescribed radiography, computed tomography, general and biochemical blood tests - Ministry of Health.    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200528233009/https://www.asiaplustj.info/ru/news/tajikistan/society/20200424/minzdrav-otvetil-na-zapros-grazhdanskogo-obtshestva-epidemiologicheskaya-situatsiya-v-strane-otnositelno-spokoinaya

In accordance with the decision of the Republican Committee on the Fight against the Covid, cinemas and theatres are suspended in the country.    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200509190401/https://asiaplustj.info/ru/news/tajikistan/power/20200425/tadzhikistan-vvel-zapret-na-eksport-zernovih-i-bobovih-i-otmenil-vse-obtshestvennie-meropriyatiya

In accordance with the decision of the republican headquarters for the prevention of coronavirus, it is forbidden to conduct all kinds of mass events such as meetings and seminars, sports events, screenings of performances in cinemas and theaters.    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200528181210/https://ria.ru/20200425/1570557714.html

The Tajikistan Football Championship is stopped until May 10 due to the coronavirus pandemic. This was reported on April 25 by the press service of the Football Federation of Tajikistan.    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200529084406/https://regnum.ru/news/sport/2929263.html

On April 25, it was announced that all schools in Dushanbe (but not universities, Asia Plus reported) would temporarily close from April 27 to May 10, “in order to protect the health and safety of the population.”     Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200524022943/https://thediplomat.com/2020/04/are-there-really-no-covid-19-cases-in-tajikistan/

Those arriving from the capital of Tajikistan, the city of Dushanbe, in the Gorno-Badakhshan Autonomous Region (GBAO), must mandatory spend 14 days in self-isolation. This decision was made by the administration of the region.    When entering the territory of GBAO, doctors measure the temperature of newly arrived citizens, and also conduct explanatory conversations with them to prevent the spread of coronavirus.    Then they are sent to compulsory two-week home quarantine, and only at the end of this time it will be possible to go to work and visit public places if there are no symptoms of COVID-19.    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200529081828/https://regnum.ru/news/polit/2932122.html

All metropolitan non-food markets in Tajikistan will be closed for 10 days from April 30 to May 10, 2020 for disinfection.    In all clothing markets in Dushanbe, "regardless of ownership and departmental affiliation," sanitary days are announced, the press service of the city hall said. During this time, the city authorities promise to carry out large-scale disinfection of outlets.    It is noted that such measures were taken to prevent the spread of coronavirus.    According to official data, no cases of coronavirus infection have been registered in Tajikistan today. However, in all regions of the country, authorities intensified preventive and disinfection work.    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200529082119/https://regnum.ru/news/polit/2933653.html

Wearing medical masks has become mandatory for all residents of Tajikistan. This decision was made today, April 30, at an emergency meeting of the Republican Headquarters for the Prevention of the Coronavirus Pandemic, chaired by the country's Prime Minister.    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200529082223/https://regnum.ru/news/society/2934479.html

Tajikistan finally confirms its first 15 coronavirus cases.    Tajikistan’s prime minister confirmed on April 30 that the nation’s health authorities have detected their first 15 cases of coronavirus, finally ending a concerted campaign of denials that the pandemic had reached the country.    Prime Minister Kohir Rasulzoda said at an emergency meeting of the Coronavirus Pandemic Prevention Committee that five cases were in Dushanbe and the other 10 in the northern Sughd region.    The announcement has come just ahead of the arrival of a World Health Organization expert mission, which is traveling to Tajikistan to help the government assess readiness for coping with a COVID-19 outbreak.    https://web.archive.org/web/20200528225850/https://eurasianet.org/tajikistan-finally-confirms-its-first-15-coronavirus-cases

The Khovar state news agency has reported that between February 1 and April 30, nearly 11,000 people have been placed in preventative quarantine. Of that total, 8,438 were discharged without showing signs of ill-health. More than 2,000 are still under observation.    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200528225850/https://eurasianet.org/tajikistan-finally-confirms-its-first-15-coronavirus-cases

Students of higher educational institutions of Tajikistan have summer vacations starting on May 4. The corresponding decision was made at an emergency meeting of the Republican headquarters to prevent the coronavirus pandemic in the country on April 30.    This order applies to first, second and third year students. Graduates of the country's universities must pass all state exams by May 15, 2020.    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200529082602/https://regnum.ru/news/society/2934494.html

Tajikistan has actively taken on the disinfection of public places.    The mobile groups of the Committee for Emergencies and Civil Defense continue to actively carry out sanitary treatment of crowded places. Disinfection is carried out using mix of sodium and calcium hypochlorite, the Tajik state-owned Khovar news agency reported, citing a source at the agency’s press center.    According to the source, employees carried out disinfection in the buildings of the prosecutor's office, court, police stations. In addition, the areas, parks of the region and the adjacent territories of the city of Bokhtar.    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200529080755/https://regnum.ru/news/society/2938201.html

Passenger vehicles between the central part of Tajikistan and the regions will not be suspended due to the spread of coronavirus, Asia-Plus reports citing the country's Ministry of Transport.    The report also states that the terminals, drivers and passengers of vehicles must undergo mandatory treatment with antiseptic. The department emphasized that drivers undergo a medical examination every day, receiving from the doctors all the necessary recommendations.    In addition, car drivers as well as passengers are required to wear medical masks.    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200529080956/https://regnum.ru/news/economy/2938130.html

In Tajikistan, summer vacations are announced ahead of schedule for students of secondary educational institutions. They will last until August 16th. This decision today, May 5, was adopted by the Republican headquarters for the prevention of the spread of coronavirus infection.      However, graduation students will take exams. Ninth graders must pass exams in four disciplines, and eleventh graders must take exams in six from June 15 to June 24, 2020.    Schooling is scheduled to resume on August 17, 2020.    In addition, holidays in kindergartens were extended too - “until the epidemiological situation in the republic is stabilized in agreement with the Republican headquarters to prevent the spread of COVID-19.”    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200529075035/https://regnum.ru/news/innovatio/2939272.html

Higher educational institutions of Tajikistan, according to the decree of the head of the Ministry of Education and Science, cannot expel contract students for late payment of tuition fees, the press service of the department reports.    This category of students will be able to pay for their studies after the stabilization of the epidemiological situation in the country, the report said.    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200529074006/https://regnum.ru/news/society/2939280.html

Residents of Sogd region are urged not to leave home unnecessarily due to the spread of the new strain of coronavirus.    Public awareness goes in several ways. Thus, leaflets with data on coronavirus are distributed in the region.    In addition, officials from the Sogd region and employees of the Coronavirus Pandemic Prevention Center walk along the streets with loudspeakers, reminding residents of precautionary measures.    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200528234329/https://tj.sputniknews.ru/country/20200511/1031219299/zhiteli-sogdian-oblast-ostavatsya-dom-koronavirus.html

AWFlagClear: All hairdressing salons, beauty salons, shops selling phones, as well as car washes by order of the Dushanbe City Hall are closed until May 31, 2020.    The press service of the mayor's office said that the decision was made in the framework of the fight against coronavirus, as well as preventing its spread throughout Tajikistan.    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200529071300/https://regnum.ru/news/economy/2947106.html

The Press Center of the Ministry of Health and Social Protection of the Population of Tajikistan launched the Single National Database on COVID-19 – covid.tj. The portal is in Tajik and Russian and will publish statistics on the number of new COVID-19 cases and deaths in Tajikistan. In addition to statistics, it also includes information on symptoms of coronavirus disease, recommendations on how to prevent it, hotline numbers for questions and answers to issues relating to the disease. Citizens will be able to get accurate and tested information on COVID-19 in Tajikistan from this site.  Source:  http://web.archive.org/web/20200609233222/http://moh.tj/new-website-on-covid-19-was-launched/?lang=en

In Tajikistan, about 50% of employees of state institutions and organizations of the city of Dushanbe were sent on unpaid leave due to the spread of the coronavirus, Asia-Plus reports citing a source in the capital’s city hall.    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200529071029/https://regnum.ru/news/polit/2958454.html

The Tajik authorities have introduced temporary restrictions on the entry of foreign nationals into the country. Land border crossings between Tajikistan and neighbouring countries are closed to travellers.     Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200528131007/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/tajikistan

According to state media and a press release from the ministry of foreign affairs, an order from January 8th introduced "enhanced security and control measures in border areas that will be applied for citizens leaving and arriving in Turkmenistan. https://web.archive.org/web/20200531234215/https://arzuw.news/vvodjatsja-povyshennye-mery-protiv-infekcionnyh-zabolevanij; https://web.archive.org/web/20200531235438/https://www.mfa.gov.tm/ru/news/1848

According to the Turkmeni Ministry of Foreign Affairs, an order from the Ministry of Health from January 8 provided a case definition for coronavirus. A later letter to the United Nations from May 5th notes "In particular, since COVID-19 first appeared in the  world, the relevant departments of the Ministry of Health and the Medical Industry  have been testing all individuals arriving in Turkmenistan from abroad. Those  arriving individuals are also subject to quarantine measures."   https://web.archive.org/web/20200601001001/https://www.mfa.gov.tm/en/news/1848; https://web.archive.org/web/20200601001204/https://www.undocs.org/en/A/74/848

On January 20, a meeting of the Extraordinary Commission on combatting the spread of diseases was held. During the meeting, the whole range of preventive measures taken to combat the spread of diseases was considered, including the work in the country's medical institutions to improve the skills of specialists and to strengthen sanitary and epidemiological surveillance.    https://web.archive.org/web/20200531235707/https://www.mfa.gov.tm/en/news/1848

During the working meeting held on the 30th of January 2020, the President of Turkmenistan Gurbanguly Berdimuhamedov gave valuable instructions on the issues of prevention of the diseases and enhancement of the medical services provided to the population.; https://web.archive.org/web/20200531235707/https://www.mfa.gov.tm/en/news/1848

"ASHGABAT, Feb 1 (Reuters) - Turkmenistan Airlines, the Central Asian nation’s state carrier, has suspended flights to and from Beijing, the company said on Saturday.    The move was aimed at preventing the spread of the 2019-nCoV virus which has prompted many other nations to suspend travel links with China, the company said in a statement."    https://web.archive.org/web/20200508194247/https://www.reuters.com/article/china-health-turkmenistan-flights/turkmenistan-airlines-suspends-air-link-with-beijing-over-virus-outbreak-idUSR4N29W02C

Turkmenistan distributes booklets informing about the dangers of coronavirus, allows school children to wear face masks and starts campaign in schools and local institutions; https://web.archive.org/web/20200531235001/https://rus.azathabar.com/a/30426223.html; https://web.archive.org/web/20200531235006/https://www.hronikatm.com/2020/02/virus-2/

The government of Turkmenistan introduced a blockade regime in Ashgabat and limited the movement of citizens between the regions of the country.   Citizens are not allowed to leave their areas of residence.   You can only leave in exceptional cases, and before that you need to get special permission from local administrations.  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200518235414/https://ru.krymr.com/a/news-koronavirus-ashhabsd-zakryli/30499268.html

"ALMATY (Reuters) - Authorities in Kazakhstan, Kyrgyzstan, Uzbekistan and Turkmenistan have announced fresh restrictions aimed at preventing the spread of coronavirus as the number of cases in Central Asia rose.     In Turkmenistan, which has so far reported no coronavirus cases, locals traveling to and from the capital, Ashgabat, said that officials at checkpoints set up around the city informed them that non-essential travel was banned.    The Turkmen government, which earlier suspended all international flights, has made no official announcements on the scope and duration of the new restrictions."    https://web.archive.org/web/20200508195314/https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-centralasia/central-asia-tightens-restrictions-as-coronavirus-spreads-idUSKBN218090

Correspondents report the closure of sports halls and fitness studios in Ashgabat. Measures have been taken as prevention of the spread of coronavirus.   Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200519000802/https://www.hronikatm.com/2020/03/sporting-events-postponed/

Correspondents report the cancellation of all sporting events and training of athletes in Turkmenistan. Measures have been taken as prevention of the spread of coronavirus.   Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200519000802/https://www.hronikatm.com/2020/03/sporting-events-postponed/

As part of the prevention of coronavirus infection, Ashgabat's catering establishments were ordered to close cafes and restaurants.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200519001727/https://turkmen.news/news/v-ashhabade-zakryli-kafe-i-restorany/

"On 30 March, 2020, teachers in Turkmenistan’s schools were notified that the spring school holidays had been extended until 6 April, 2020.      A female teacher from an Ashgabat school told a correspondent of “Chronicles of Turkmenistan” that supervising teachers were charged with the task of calling all students and informing parents that the schoolchildren will have an additional week of spring break.      The instructions came as a surprise for the teaching staff who had not been warned in advance that spring holidays might be extended and school would be closed down.    It is obvious that the decision was made in line with the measures undertaken by the government to prevent the spread of coronavirus in Turkmenistan.    It should be highlighted that due to the global pandemic of coronavirus COVID-19 Turkmenistan is imposing contradictory measures: on the one hand, the authorities claim there are no confirmed coronavirus cases in the country but on the other hand, movement  has been restricted in some cities. Sports events have been cancelled and fitness clubs have been closed down but large-scale festive events are still underway and  theatres are still open for the public."  https://web.archive.org/web/20200508193010/https://en.hronikatm.com/2020/03/school-holidays-in-turkmenistan-extended-for-a-week/

While media articles from March 31 claim that the word "Coronavirus" was banned in Turkmenistan, this seems to be not entirely accurate and more down to self-censorship of local (state-controlled) media. While "coronavirus" was removed from the leaflets handed out to the public, the general preventative advice seems to have continued circulating (even without "coronavirus" specifically being mentioned); https://web.archive.org/web/20200601001442/https://thediplomat.com/2020/04/did-turkmenistan-really-ban-the-word-coronavirus/

Gyms and sports clubs reopen in Ashgabat on April 1. Further article from April 7 suggest that cafes and restaurants are open again as well; https://web.archive.org/web/20200531230807/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19 (gyms and sports clubs); https://web.archive.org/web/20200531230950/https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-52186521 (cafes and restaurants)

Original note from Oksana Matiiash: In connection with the COVID-19, a telephone hotline has been launched by the Ministry of Health and the Medical Industry in order to inform the population about the epidemiological situation in the country, measures taken to prevent the importation of coronavirus and methods of protection and prevention from this disease.

The temperature is measured by everyone who passes through the points of entry. If temperature is detected, these individuals are isolated by taking nasal and throat swabs for virological testing on COVID-19. There are specialized medical institutions in Turkmenistan where people who are isolated for quarantine are treated.  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200519003509/https://www.trend.az/casia/turkmenistan/3216160.html

The leadership of schools in the capital of Turkmenistan ordered all students to donate 100 manat for disinfection of educational institutions. The innovation was announced to the children on their first day after the end of spring break.  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200519142047/https://regnum.ru/news/economy/2908801.html

Turkmenistan resumed football season despite coronavirus pandemic. The Ministry of Sports said the decision to resume the football season “pleased the army of fans” and was supported by the players.  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200519012131/https://rus.azathabar.com/a/30565770.html

Turkmenistan has reopened most of its border crossing points and is preparing to open the rest on the border with Iran: https://web.archive.org/web/20200519011327/https://rus.azathabar.com/a/30571830.html

The Minister of Health of Turkmenistan said at the same briefing that the country had 30,000 test kits at its disposal, another 40,000 were ordered from Russia, Turkey and Germany.  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200519011327/https://rus.azathabar.com/a/30571830.html

Turkmenistan in letter to UN: "An important aspect in countering the spread of a dangerous communicable disease is the careful regulation of internal migration in the country. Special procedures have been introduced to govern entry into and exit from border regions. Traffic on highways and railways is monitored by health and internal affairs officials. This too is a temporary measure in force only while the spread of this dangerous worldwide infection is being addressed." https://web.archive.org/web/20200531232133/https://www.undocs.org/en/A/74/848

Turkmeni leader to UN: "The number of international flights also began to decrease. Currently, by decision of the Government Commission, one-off flights can be organized at the request of foreign embassies to repatriate foreign citizens to their countries of residence. These arrangements are strictly temporary." https://web.archive.org/web/20200531232133/https://www.undocs.org/en/A/74/848

Turkmenistan in letter to UN: "The most important element in the fight against coronavirus disease is  education, the main purpose of which is to ensure a clear understanding by the  population of the danger of a new communicable condition. Such education efforts  are ongoing everywhere among all segments of the population – in kindergartens,  schools, higher education institutions, military units, enterprises and establishments.  The norms of social behaviour, rules of personal hygiene and other nec essary  information are being explained to the population. With full understanding of the  importance of health education, the Government is taking measures to involve  scientists, teachers, representatives of civil society and artists in campaigning and  educational activities, and is using the opportunities offered by the media." https://web.archive.org/web/20200531232133/https://www.undocs.org/en/A/74/848

WHO's social and hygiene recommendations against the spread of the new coronavirus, including social distance, self-isolation, wearing medical masks, total disinfection of public places and mass diagnosis in Turkmenistan, are not respected. At the same time, the president of the country is taking extraordinary measures to protect himself and his family from possible infection with the coronavirus.  According to sources from Radio Azatlyk in Ashgabat, President Gurbanguly Berdimuhamedov suddenly changed his place of residence due to the potential risk of coronavirus infection.  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200519005702/https://rus.azathabar.com/a/30609470.html
Now, to enter the capital, residents of other regions must carry with them an up to date lung X-ray image. http://web.archive.org/web/20200608200635/https://rus.azathabar.com/a/30634997.html

Students who are finishing their education abroad will not be able to return home, according to the Turkmen government. Their parents have already been notified. Notably, in Lebap, parents will be given an opportunity to deposit around $200 monthly on their children's bank cards. http://web.archive.org/web/20200608200635/https://rus.azathabar.com/a/30634997.html

During a briefing at the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Turkmenistan, the Minister underlined the importance of international cooperation in jointly combatting the novel coronavirus. He also announced that Turkmenistan will be joining the Technology Access Pool (C-TAP) platform, the creation of which has been announced by WHO.     http://web.archive.org/web/20200608201653/https://www.mfa.gov.tm/ru/news/2075

The Ministry of Health began sharing on his Facebook page basic preventive measures against COVID-19, originally posted by WHO.    Link: http://web.archive.org/web/20200528214226/https://www.facebook.com/MinisteriodaSaudeTL?_rdc=1&_rdr=

Screening instituted at entry points — land, air, and sea border controls. This includes  the use of temperature scanning and use of Health Declaration cards at Dili  International Airport. Vigilance and screening has also been introduced at seaports and  land border controls    Link: http://web.archive.org/web/20200530152808/https://www.who.int/docs/default-source/searo/timor-leste/03-02-2020-tls-sitrep-1-ncov-revised.pdf?sfvrsn=cb480d79_2

1) Prohibition of entry into the national territory of foreign citizens who transited in the Hubei Province in the last 4 weeks.  2) Foreigners who have transited in China in the last 4 weeks will have to show a medical certificate.  3) Timorese citizens or foreigners born in Timor-Leste and residing in the country are not forbidden entry  4) Any citizen who comes into the national territory and refuses to go back to their country despite being prohibited must undergo mandatory quarantine.  5) Timorese citizens coming from China should undergo voluntary quarantine of 14 days.    Link: http://web.archive.org/web/20200530145322/http://www.mj.gov.tl/jornal/public/docs/2020/serie_1/SERIE_I_NO_6_A.pdf

Protocols for case detection and contact tracing have been updated based on the new revised  surveillance guidelines. Surveillance teams and rapid responders at national and municipality level have been trained and are on standby to detect and respond to COVID-19 alerts in the country.    Link: http://web.archive.org/web/20200530153458/https://www.who.int/docs/default-source/searo/timor-leste/03-03-2020-tls-sitrep-15-ncov-eng.pdf?sfvrsn=e7702ec7_2

There is no official policy document on testing. However, WHO situation reports suggest that tests are underway and that symptomatic patients are being tested: "Currently, there are NO cases of Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID–19). However, the Ministry of Health remains vigilant and ready to respond appropriately as the situation develops. Suspected COVID-19 Case 1 whose test result came as negative from the laboratory in Australia was announced by the Ministry of Health (MoH) in a press conference on Tuesday, 10 March 2020. The person was discharged and poses no threat to public health. Suspected COVID-19 Case 2 test results came as negative. However, since the person still has symptoms, a second swab sample will be collected and sent to Australia for a second test in the next few days. In the meantime, the person is stable and remains in isolation under medical observation. The MoH is monitoring the situation closely with support from WHO and partners. Two more persons – one Timorese and one foreign national were also tested for COVID-19 but the test result from Australia came back as negative. They DO NOT have COVID-19 infection. These did not meet the criteria for the suspected case, but samples were sent by HNGV as a precautionary measure."      Link: http://web.archive.org/web/20200604092533/https://www.who.int/docs/default-source/searo/timor-leste/11-03-2020-tls-sitrep-17-ncov-eng.pdf?sfvrsn=fb20eee9_2  http://web.archive.org/web/20200604092535/https://www.who.int/docs/default-source/searo/timor-leste/13-03-2020-tls-sitrep-18-ncov-eng.pdf?sfvrsn=9df102cd_2

The Council of Ministers approved a draft Government Resolution, presented by the Minister of Foreign Affairs and Cooperation, Dionísio da Costa Babo Soares, for the extension of the application and implementation of temporary interdiction measures and restriction of entry into national territory of foreign citizens, who in the last four weeks have left or been in transit in the People's Republic of China, the Republic of Korea, the Italian Republic and the Islamic Republic of Iran.    Link: http://web.archive.org/web/20200530143038/http://timor-leste.gov.tl/?p=23729&lang=en  http://web.archive.org/web/20200530151308/http://www.tatoli.tl/en/2020/03/11/timor-bans-travellers-arriving-from-covid-19-hotspots/

With government resolution 10/2020, the government prohibits entry to all foreign citizens who come from or have transited in countries affected by Coronavirus in the last 4 weeks, according to WHO regulation. This excludes foreign citizens born in Timor-Leste and that habitually reside here, or that represent legally Timorese minors and foreign minors that reside in Timor-Leste. However they must undergo a period of quarantine of 14 days. The PM can allow exceptions to this rule for national interest or security reasons. All individuals, including Timorese, are forbidden from disembarking cruise ships and enter the national territory.  Business travel of public servants is also prohibited (both direct and indirect state administration offcials). The resolution is effective the day after its publication, hence on March 20.    Link: http://web.archive.org/web/20200523184823/http://www.laohamutuk.org/Justice/2020/JRRes10MedidasExcecionais19Mar2020pt.pdf

On March 22, the Ministry of Education, Youth and Sport announced in a press release that all primary and secondary schools, private and public would close from March 23 to March 28, highlighting that students should stay at home and follow hygiene practices. The Ministry of Higher Education and Culture announced that tertiary education institutions would remain close from March 23 to April 4.     Link: http://web.archive.org/web/20200525200928/http://www.laohamutuk.org/Justice/2020/MEJD-21-03-20202en.pdfhttp://web.archive.org/web/20200525200537/http://www.laohamutuk.org/Justice/2020/MEJD-21-03-20202te.pdf    http://web.archive.org/web/20200525200653/http://www.laohamutuk.org/Justice/2020/UnisClose22Mar2020te.pdf

The Ministry of Transport and Communication launched a hotline for citizens to solves doubts and provides assistance on COVID-19-related matters.    Link: http://web.archive.org/web/20200530110247/http://www.tatoli.tl/2020/03/23/governu-kria-lina-telefonika-numeru-119-asesu-informasaun-kona-ba-covid-19/

In decree n.º 3/2020 of March 28th, the government ruled for the suspension of in-person classroom activities and closure of the facilities of education, teaching, and professional training establishments. Distance learning should be promoted through ICT technology.     These measures are set to continue throughout the state of emergency, which is in force between 00:00 hours on March 28, 2020, and 23:59 hours on April 26, 2020, and applies to the entire national territory.    Link: http://web.archive.org/web/20200523165049/http://timor-leste.gov.tl/?p=23931&lang=en  http://web.archive.org/web/20200523165206/http://timor-leste.gov.tl/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/02-DL-Medidas-Exec-Dec-Est-Emerg-p-Dec-Pres-Rep-A-01-ENG_FULL-DOC_MC_REV_final-version-B-02-VLL-final.pdf

Government Decree n. 3/2020 of March 28 on the Measures for the Implementation of the Declaration of State of Emergency introduced by Decree of the President of the Republic n.º29/2020, of 27 March, established the following regulation for workplaces:    Public sector: Members of the Government and directors of public legal entities that are part of the indirect administration of the State will identify the human resources strictly necessary to ensure the functioning of their services under the regime of minimum services. Minimum services are those the provision of which provision is essential to ensure the functioning of the Public Administration and the provision, to citizens and companies, of goods and services that are of an urgent nature. Public Administration staff who are exempt from the duty to appear in their workplace must remain reachable by phone and appear whenever summoned by their  hierarchical superior.     Private sector: Commercial and service establishments, markets, and street vendors are allowed. Individuals wishing to access the commercial and services premises are required to use mouth and nose protection mask; clean hands before entering said facilities; respect the distance of at least one meter from other individuals. Those responsible for commercial and services premises have an obligation to make available, at the entrance of their facilities.    These regulations are in place for the entire duration of the State of Emergency, now set to last until April 26, 2020.    Link: http://web.archive.org/web/20200525211506/http://www.laohamutuk.org/Justice/2020/GovDecree3SoEen.pdf  http://web.archive.org/web/20200525211610/http://www.laohamutuk.org/Justice/2020/F-estado-de-emergencia-iniciativa-privada-2-ENG.pdf

Government Decree 3/2020 ruled that any social, cultural and sporting events that involve the gathering of people is prohibited for the entire state of emergency, lasting from March 28 to April 26.    Link: http://web.archive.org/web/20200523165206/http://timor-leste.gov.tl/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/02-DL-Medidas-Exec-Dec-Est-Emerg-p-Dec-Pres-Rep-A-01-ENG_FULL-DOC_MC_REV_final-version-B-02-VLL-final.pdf

In decree n.º 3/2020 of March 28th, the government ruled for the prohibition of the gathering of more than 5 people. The prohibition holds for the entire period of declared State of Emergency, not set to end on April 26, 2020.    Link: http://web.archive.org/web/20200525205218/http://www.laohamutuk.org/Justice/2020/GovDecree3SoEen.pdf

Law decree 3/2020 rules that collective passenger transport activities are suspended for the entire period of state of emergency. The state of emergency is in force between 00:00 hours on March 28, 2020 and 23:59 hours on April 26, 2020 and applies to the entire national territory.    Link: http://web.archive.org/web/20200523165206/http://timor-leste.gov.tl/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/02-DL-Medidas-Exec-Dec-Est-Emerg-p-Dec-Pres-Rep-A-01-ENG_FULL-DOC_MC_REV_final-version-B-02-VLL-final.pdf

Government decree 3/2020 established the following:   (1) Individuals who are not subject to mandatory isolation and who do not carry out any  professional activity or can work from home have to remain inside their homes and limit their movement outside to the minimum necessary, including to go to the doctor, to go grocery shopping, or for important matters.  (2) Compulsory isolation in a health facility or their homes applies to all those infected with Coronavirus until they are discharged.  (3) Compulsory isolation for all individuals who enter the national territory for at  14 days  Link: http://timor-leste.gov.tl/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/02-DL-Medidas-Exec-Dec-Est-Emerg-p-Dec-Pres-Rep-A-01-ENG_FULL-DOC_MC_REV_final-version-B-02-VLL-final.pdf

Government decree 3/2020 prohibits the entry of foreigners into national territory, except for foreigners born in Timor-Leste, resident citizens and legal representatives of minors of Timorese nationality. The Prime Minister may exceptionally authorise the entry of foreigners, in duly substantiated cases, relating to the defence of the national interest or convenience of service. This prohibition does not apply to oil rig workers located in the Timor Sea.    Foreigners responsible for the transport of goods or release of imported goods must remain in the international zone of seaports, airports or land border posts.    Link: http://web.archive.org/web/20200523165206/http://timor-leste.gov.tl/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/02-DL-Medidas-Exec-Dec-Est-Emerg-p-Dec-Pres-Rep-A-01-ENG_FULL-DOC_MC_REV_final-version-B-02-VLL-final.pdf

The Ministry of Public Works established a 15$ subsidy for electricity fees.    Link: http://web.archive.org/web/20200604085819/https://www.facebook.com/antsampaio/posts/10158067670813399  http://web.archive.org/web/20200604085853/http://www.tatoli.tl/2020/03/30/mop-deside-fo-subsidiu-pre-pagu-eletrisidade-15-ba-kliente-hamutuk-170-555/

The government amended decree 3/2020 and ruled for closing borders to all individuals, foreigners and Timorese from April 13 until further notice.    Link: http://web.archive.org/web/20200528211251/http://www.laohamutuk.org/Justice/2020/MFA8Apr2020en.png

The government approved additional financial support:   1. Subsidy internet access to students   2. Maintained subsidy for electricity fees of $15 per month  3. Suspension of payments for water fees  4. Suspension of social security payments and payment of rent on government property    Link: http://web.archive.org/web/20200606082004/http://timor-leste.gov.tl/?p=24159&n=1&lang=pt  http://web.archive.org/web/20200604084550/http://www.tatoli.tl/2020/04/22/governu-hakarak-oferese-tan-subsidiu-pre-pagu-eletrisidade-ba-fulan-tolu/  http://web.archive.org/web/20200606082147/http://www.tatoli.tl/2020/04/29/governu-aprova-millaun-2-hodi-fo-subsidiu-ba-estudante/

On 27 April, Parliament debated and then approved the 30-day extension of the State of Emergency, until May 27. The President of the Republic promulgated the law. Therefore, according to the State of Emergency's directions, all schools remain close.    Link: http://web.archive.org/web/20200525201913/http://www.laohamutuk.org/Justice/2020/JRPRDec32&PNLei2ProlongEE27Apr2020pt.pdf

On 27 April, Parliament debated and then approved the 30-day extension of the State of Emergency, until May 27. The President of the Republic promulgated the law. Therefore, according to the State of Emergency's directions, commercial activities can remain open a long as they implement sanitary measures and social distancing, while the public sector continues to function at minimum capacity.  Link: http://web.archive.org/web/20200523182555/http://www.laohamutuk.org/Justice/2020/JRPRDec32&PNLei2ProlongEE27Apr2020pt.pdf

On 27 April, Parliament debated and then approved the 30-day extension of the State of Emergency, until May 27. The President of the Republic promulgated the law. Therefore, according to the State of Emergency's directions, any social, cultural, and sporting events that involve the gathering of people continue being prohibited for the entire state of emergency.  Link: http://web.archive.org/web/20200523182555/http://www.laohamutuk.org/Justice/2020/JRPRDec32&PNLei2ProlongEE27Apr2020pt.pdf

On 27 April, Parliament debated and then approved the 30-day extension of the State of Emergency, until May 27. The President of the Republic promulgated the law. Therefore, according to the State of Emergency's directions, the gathering of more than 5 people remains forbidden.    Link: http://web.archive.org/web/20200523182555/http://www.laohamutuk.org/Justice/2020/JRPRDec32&PNLei2ProlongEE27Apr2020pt.pdf

On 27 April, Parliament debated and then approved the 30-day extension of the State of Emergency, until May 27. The President of the Republic promulgated the law. Therefore, according to the State of Emergency's directions, all public transport remains suspended.    Link: http://web.archive.org/web/20200523182555/http://www.laohamutuk.org/Justice/2020/JRPRDec32&PNLei2ProlongEE27Apr2020pt.pdf

On 27 April, Parliament debated and then approved the 30-day extension of the State of Emergency, until May 27. The President of the Republic promulgated the law. Therefore, according to the State of Emergency's directions, stay at homes is not mandatory but encouraged.    Link: http://web.archive.org/web/20200523182555/http://www.laohamutuk.org/Justice/2020/JRPRDec32&PNLei2ProlongEE27Apr2020pt.pdf

n Government Decree no. 8/2020 of April 30 on the Measures for the Implementation of the Declaration of State of Emergency introduced by Decree of the President of the Republic no. 32/2020, of 27 April, the Government ruled that the measures on workplace openingmand closing are maintained: namely, commercial activities are allowed to continue operating as long as they implement social distancing and sanitary measures, while the public administration shall work at minimum capacity only.    This regulation holds for the entire State of Emergency, now set to end on May 27, 2020.    Link: http://web.archive.org/web/20200525203857/http://www.laohamutuk.org/Justice/2020/D8-2020MedidasEE30Apr2020en.pdf

In Government Decree no. 8/2020 of April 30 on the Measures for the Implementation of the Declaration of State of Emergency introduced by Decree of the President of the Republic no. 32/2020, of 27 April, the Government ruled that any social, cultural or sporting events that involve the gathering of people are prohibited.    This regulation holds for the entire State of Emergency, now set to end on May 27, 2020.    Link: http://web.archive.org/web/20200525203857/http://www.laohamutuk.org/Justice/2020/D8-2020MedidasEE30Apr2020en.pdf

In Government Decree no. 8/2020 of April 30 on the Measures for the Implementation of the Declaration of State of Emergency introduced by Decree of the President of the Republic no. 32/2020, of 27 April, the Government ruled that meetings or demonstrations that involve the agglomeration of more than five people are prohibited    This regulation holds for the entire State of Emergency, now set to end on May 27, 2020.    Link: http://web.archive.org/web/20200525203857/http://www.laohamutuk.org/Justice/2020/D8-2020MedidasEE30Apr2020en.pdf

In Government Decree no. 8/2020 of April 30 on the Measures for the Implementation of the Declaration of State of Emergency introduced by Decree of the President of the Republic no. 32/2020, of 27 April, the Government ruled that public transport is permitted, under the public p provided that (1) vehicles are cleaned daily before starting each journey, (2) drivers, crews and passengers wear protective masks, (3) individuals are refused entry if they do not comply, (4) Social distancing is adopted among passengers.    This regulation holds for the entire State of Emergency, now set to end on May 27, 2020. In Government Decree no. 8/2020 of April 30 on the Measures for the Implementation of the Declaration of State of Emergency introduced by Decree of the President of the Republic no. 32/2020, of 27 April, the Government ruled that (1) Individuals who are not subject to mandatory isolation and who do not carry out any  professional activity or can work from home have to remain inside their homes and limit their movement outside to the minimum necessary, including to go to the doctor, to go grocery shopping, or for important matters.  (2) Compulsory isolation in a health facility or their homes applies to all those infected with Coronavirus until they are discharged.  (3) Compulsory isolation for all individuals who enter the national territory for at  14 days    Link: http://web.archive.org/web/20200602221903/http://timor-leste.gov.tl/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/EE2-sai-husi-umaa2.pdf  http://web.archive.org/web/20200602223700/http://timor-leste.gov.tl/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Decreto-do-Governo-Medidas-de-execuc%CC%A7a%CC%83o-da-declarac%CC%A7a%CC%83o-do-estado-de-emerge%CC%82ncia-efetuada-pelo-Decreto-do-Presidente-da-Repu%CC%81blica-n-32-2020-de-27-de-abril-D.pdf

The government approved a monthly payment of US $100 per household as a short-term intervention to address a specific threat to livelihoods, the economy, and society as a result of the COVID-19 pandemic. It applies to all households with monthly incomes of up to US $500 that are registered in the national "Register of Uma Kain" (neighborhood-level registry). Given that average income is $40 for rural households and $206 for urban households, according to the 2011 Household Income and Expenditure Survey 2011, this transfer exceeds 50% of lost income. Payments will be financed by the COVID-19 Fund.    Additionally, in a separate diploma, the government established support measures for the private sector, comprising employers and employees, provided that persons are registered in the social security contribution scheme. In particular, it grants:  a) a subsidy of up to 60% of the wage cost and b) exemption from the duty to pay social security contributions, for formal sector workers who have to be quarantined or stay at home during the pandemic. The support is financed by the COVID-19 Fund.    Link: http://web.archive.org/web/20200602212101/http://www.statistics.gov.tl/wp-content/uploads/2013/12/HIES2011_Report_20-_20Final.pdf  http://web.archive.org/web/20200602212115/http://www.laohamutuk.org/Justice/2020/DL15HouseholdSupport30Apr2020en.pdf   http://web.archive.org/web/20200602213733/http://www.laohamutuk.org/Justice/2020/DL16SubsEmprego30Apr2020en.pdf

The government approved an extension on the state of emergency, whose restrictions now only regard to the sanitary control at the entrance and exit points of the national territory, circulation in national territory and establishment of residence are maintained. The execution measures relating to school closure are clarified in a decree approved on April 29, stating the following:    Pre-school, primary education, secondary education, higher education, and vocational or technical-vocational training establishments may carry out school activities on a face-to-face basis. The performance of school activities in person will depend on compliance with the technical standards that are approved for this purpose by the Minister of Health in coordination with the relevant government.    Link:   http://web.archive.org/web/20200606073432/http://www.laohamutuk.org/Justice/2020/JRPresDec35Lei4-27Maiu2020pt.pdf  http://web.archive.org/web/20200606071429/http://timor-leste.gov.tl/?p=24530&lang=en  http://web.archive.org/web/20200606073342/http://www.laohamutuk.org/Justice/2020/GovDec9-29May2020en.pdf

The government approved an extension on the state of emergency, whose restrictions now only regard to the sanitary control at the entrance and exit points of the national territory, circulation in national territory and establishment of residence are maintained. The execution measures relating to workplace closure are clarified in a decree approved on April 29 stating the following:    As in the previous regulation, private businesses are allowed to operate provided that they implement social distancing and sanitary measures.     Now the public sector is also allowed to operate at full capacity. They must ensure social distance and that implement sanitary measures.    Link:   http://web.archive.org/web/20200606073432/http://www.laohamutuk.org/Justice/2020/JRPresDec35Lei4-27Maiu2020pt.pdf  http://web.archive.org/web/20200606071429/http://timor-leste.gov.tl/?p=24530&lang=en  http://web.archive.org/web/20200606073342/http://www.laohamutuk.org/Justice/2020/GovDec9-29May2020en.pdf

The government approved an extension on the state of emergency, whose restrictions now only regard to the sanitary control at the entrance and exit points of the national territory, circulation in national territory and establishment of residence are maintained. The execution measures, clarified in a decree approved on April 29 stating the following, make no mention of restrictions on public events. In a press release, the government stated that there are also no limitations on religious, sporting activities, and the right to strike and demonstration.    Link:   http://web.archive.org/web/20200606073432/http://www.laohamutuk.org/Justice/2020/JRPresDec35Lei4-27Maiu2020pt.pdf  http://web.archive.org/web/20200606071429/http://timor-leste.gov.tl/?p=24530&lang=en  http://web.archive.org/web/20200606073342/http://www.laohamutuk.org/Justice/2020/GovDec9-29May2020en.pdf

The government approved an extension on the state of emergency, whose restrictions now only regard to the sanitary control at the entrance and exit points of the national territory, circulation in national territory and establishment of residence are maintained. The execution measures, clarified in a decree approved on April 29 stating the following, make no mention of restriction on gatherings. In a press release, the government stated that there are also no limitations on religious, sporting activities, and the right to strike and demonstration.    Link:   http://web.archive.org/web/20200606073432/http://www.laohamutuk.org/Justice/2020/JRPresDec35Lei4-27Maiu2020pt.pdf  http://web.archive.org/web/20200606071429/http://timor-leste.gov.tl/?p=24530&lang=en  http://web.archive.org/web/20200606073342/http://www.laohamutuk.org/Justice/2020/GovDec9-29May2020en.pdf

The government approved an extension on the state of emergency, whose restrictions now only regard to the sanitary control at the entrance and exit points of the national territory, circulation in national territory and establishment of residence are maintained. The execution measures, clarified in a decree approved on April 29 stating the following, make no mention of restrictions on public transport which remains allowed, as in previous regulation, provided that social distancing and sanitary measures are observed.    Link:   http://web.archive.org/web/20200606073432/http://www.laohamutuk.org/Justice/2020/JRPresDec35Lei4-27Maiu2020pt.pdf  http://web.archive.org/web/20200606071429/http://timor-leste.gov.tl/?p=24530&lang=en  http://web.archive.org/web/20200606073342/http://www.laohamutuk.org/Justice/2020/GovDec9-29May2020en.pdf

The government approved an extension on the state of emergency, whose restrictions now only regard to the sanitary control at the entrance and exit points of the national territory, circulation in national territory and establishment of residence are maintained. The execution measures are clarified in a decree approved on April 29 stating that individuals who are not subject to mandatory isolation and who do not carry out any professional activity or are exempt from fulfilling the duty to be present at the workplace must remain inside their homes and limit their movement outside to the minimum necessary. However, there is no prohibition of internal movement, as clarified in a government pamphlet (see link).    Link:   http://web.archive.org/web/20200606073432/http://www.laohamutuk.org/Justice/2020/JRPresDec35Lei4-27Maiu2020pt.pdf  http://web.archive.org/web/20200606071429/http://timor-leste.gov.tl/?p=24530&lang=en  http://web.archive.org/web/20200606073342/http://www.laohamutuk.org/Justice/2020/GovDec9-29May2020en.pdf  http://web.archive.org/web/20200606075632/http://timor-leste.gov.tl/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/EE2-sai-husi-umaa2.pdf

The government approved an extension on the state of emergency, whose restrictions now only regard to the sanitary control at the entrance and exit points of the national territory, circulation in national territory and establishment of residence are maintained. The execution measures are clarified in a decree approved on April 29 . There continues to be no mention of restriction on internal movement.    Link:   http://web.archive.org/web/20200606073432/http://www.laohamutuk.org/Justice/2020/JRPresDec35Lei4-27Maiu2020pt.pdf  http://web.archive.org/web/20200606071429/http://timor-leste.gov.tl/?p=24530&lang=en  http://web.archive.org/web/20200606073342/http://www.laohamutuk.org/Justice/2020/GovDec9-29May2020en.pdf

The government approved an extension on the state of emergency, whose restrictions now only regard to the sanitary control at the entrance and exit points of the national territory, circulation in national territory and establishment of residence are maintained. The execution measures are clarified in a decree approved on April 29, stating that entry into the national territory is forbidden to foreign nationals. The prohibition does not apply to foreign nationals who were born in Timor-Leste territory and who usually reside here or who are the legal representatives of Timorese minors or third-country nationals who are legal residents of Timor-Leste over whom they exercise parental authority or ensure their support and education. The prohibition provided does not apply to foreign nationals who carry out their professional activity on oil platforms located in the Timor Sea.    Link:   http://web.archive.org/web/20200606073432/http://www.laohamutuk.org/Justice/2020/JRPresDec35Lei4-27Maiu2020pt.pdf  http://web.archive.org/web/20200606071429/http://timor-leste.gov.tl/?p=24530&lang=en  http://web.archive.org/web/20200606073342/http://www.laohamutuk.org/Justice/2020/GovDec9-29May2020en.pdf  http://web.archive.org/web/20200606075632/http://timor-leste.gov.tl/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/EE2-sai-husi-umaa2.pdf

Previous measures are still ongoing. As stated in the relative decree-law, monetary support is provided from April 2020 and for as long as the state of emergency lasts. The state of emergency was renewed on May 27 and is set to last until June 26 at least.      Link: http://web.archive.org/web/20200602212101/http://www.statistics.gov.tl/wp-content/uploads/2013/12/HIES2011_Report_20-_20Final.pdf  http://web.archive.org/web/20200602212115/http://www.laohamutuk.org/Justice/2020/DL15HouseholdSupport30Apr2020en.pdf   http://web.archive.org/web/20200602213733/http://www.laohamutuk.org/Justice/2020/DL16SubsEmprego30Apr2020en.pdf  http://web.archive.org/web/20200606073432/http://www.laohamutuk.org/Justice/2020/JRPresDec35Lei4-27Maiu2020pt.pdf

Previous measures are still ongoing. The electricity subsidy was established to last for 3 months, as stated in an article on April 22. No mention was made of the interruption of other contract relief on water fees, social security, and rent on government property     Link:  http://web.archive.org/web/20200606082004/http://timor-leste.gov.tl/?p=24159&n=1&lang=pt  http://web.archive.org/web/20200604084550/http://www.tatoli.tl/2020/04/22/governu-hakarak-oferese-tan-subsidiu-pre-pagu-eletrisidade-ba-fulan-tolu/  http://web.archive.org/web/20200606082147/http://www.tatoli.tl/2020/04/29/governu-aprova-millaun-2-hodi-fo-subsidiu-ba-estudante/

There is no official policy document on testing. However, WHO situation reports suggest that tests are underway and that symptomatic patients are being tested: "Currently, there are NO cases of Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID–19). However, the Ministry of Health remains vigilant and ready to respond appropriately as the situation develops. Suspected COVID-19 Case 1 whose test result came as negative from the laboratory in Australia was announced by the Ministry of Health (MoH) in a press conference on Tuesday, 10 March 2020. The person was discharged and poses no threat to public health. Suspected COVID-19 Case 2 test results came as negative. However, since the person still has symptoms, a second swab sample will be collected and sent to Australia for a second test in the next few days. In the meantime, the person is stable and remains in isolation under medical observation. The MoH is monitoring the situation closely with support from WHO and partners. Two more persons – one Timorese and one foreign national were also tested for COVID-19 but the test result from Australia came back as negative. They DO NOT have COVID-19 infection. These did not meet the criteria for the suspected case, but samples were sent by HNGV as a precautionary measure."    Additionally the Ministry of Health publishes bulletins on its facebook page showing that tests are increasing despite no recorded cases in weeks.      Link: http://web.archive.org/web/20200604092533/https://www.who.int/docs/default-source/searo/timor-leste/11-03-2020-tls-sitrep-17-ncov-eng.pdf?sfvrsn=fb20eee9_2  http://web.archive.org/web/20200604092535/https://www.who.int/docs/default-source/searo/timor-leste/13-03-2020-tls-sitrep-18-ncov-eng.pdf?sfvrsn=9df102cd_2  http://web.archive.org/web/20200606083652/https://www.facebook.com/MinisteriodaSaudeTL?_rdc=1&_rdr=

"On January 30, 2020 the Cabinet took the decision to impose travel restrictions on anyone who had been in China for a 14 days period prior to their arrival in Trinidad and Tobago. We imposed the restriction that any non-national who had been in China for a period of 14 days prior to their arrival in Trinidad and Tobago would not be permitted entry and any national or resident who fell into this category would be quarantined until it was clear that they were not affected by COVID 19."    (https://web.archive.org/web/20200413110343/https://www.opm.gov.tt/prime-minister-dr-the-hon-keith-rowleys-parliament-statement-on-covid-19/)

First announcement on Government website with advice to the public regarding coronavirus.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200430110210/http://www.news.gov.tt/content/no-confirmed-or-suspected-cases-novel-coronavirus-date-all-screening-protocols-place

"On February 27, 2020 the Cabinet took a number of decisions including the adding of Iran, South Korea, Italy, Singapore and Japan to the list of designated countries that we would not permit non-nationals or residents entry to Trinidad and Tobago if they had been in any of these countries for 14 days prior." Reesidents/Nationals would similarly be quarantined as with China. (https://web.archive.org/web/20200413110343/https://www.opm.gov.tt/prime-minister-dr-the-hon-keith-rowleys-parliament-statement-on-covid-19/)

Government begins releasing daily 'Trinidad and Tobago COVID-19 (Novel Coronavirus) Updates'.   https://web.archive.org/save/http://www.news.gov.tt/content/trinidad-and-tobago-covid-19-novel-coronavirus-update-1#.XpRoalNKg1I

First public announcement states the country has "Number of samples submitted to the Caribbean Public Health Agency (CARPHA) for testing for COVID-19 = 25", and no positive tests.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200413144759/http://www.news.gov.tt/content/trinidad-and-tobago-covid-19-novel-coronavirus-update-1

Government recommends that employers allow people to work from home where feasible and act on Public Health recommendations. (https://web.archive.org/web/20200413122852/https://www.opm.gov.tt/prime-minister-dr-the-hon-keith-rowleys-parliament-statement-on-covid-19/)

Since March 19: the Trinidad and Tobago Electricity Commission “will immediately stop disconnections as a result of non-payment.  This will directly impact 87% of residential customers, who are most likely experiencing financial vulnerability at this time.”  http://web.archive.org/web/20200504191719/http://www.news.gov.tt/content/implementation-social-support-measures-covid-19  March: “over 3,800 VAT refund payments in cash were made to businesses with outstanding arrears of $250,000 per VAT period or less, at a cost of $260 million (...) as for Income Tax, to date, $116 million in income tax refunds of $20,000 or less has been paid to 17,195 individuals with $124 million approved for payment to another 7,900 individuals within the next two weeks, clearing off all outstanding individual income tax refunds, at a cost of $240 million”.  “The period covered by the VAT Return is referred to as the tax period. The standard tax period is two (2) months (...) Each return is due on or before the 25th day of the month following the end of the tax period. ”  More information about the measures could be found in the following links:   http://web.archive.org/web/20200504184415/https://www.looptt.com/content/imbert-budget-pegged-us25-oil-price-deficit-revised-155b  http://web.archive.org/web/20200504223438/http://www.ird.gov.tt/submission-of-the-vat-return

“Income Support Grants of up to $1,500 per month per household, for persons who are outside of the NIS and BIR systems who have lost their jobs or incomes as a result of COVID-19.” The first payment “was wired to the bank accounts of recipients on Tuesday evening [April 28]”. The assistance represents more than 50% of the minimum wage in Trinidad and Tobago, that is of $15 TT per hour or, approximately, $2,250 TT per month. Here’s the links that explain the extraordinary measures during COVID:  http://web.archive.org/web/20200504184415/https://www.looptt.com/content/imbert-budget-pegged-us25-oil-price-deficit-revised-155b  http://web.archive.org/web/20200504201630/https://www.looptt.com/content/first-set-salary-relief-grants-wired-bank-accounts-recipients    Since May 1, the government also launched a “new emergency food support to new beneficiaries in which 30,000 food baskets would be delivered to citizens over four months. Included in the basket would be a $250 supermarket voucher, two chickens, and locally grown fruits and vegetables sourced by Namdevco.” The voucher represents 11% of the minimum wage.   http://web.archive.org/web/20200504201709/https://newsday.co.tt/2020/05/03/fraudsters-tap-into-covid19-grants/  The government has also developed a Rental Assistance program, that “will be paid directly to the landlords and not tenants.” Specific amounts of the assistance were not found.   http://web.archive.org/web/20200504184322/https://www.looptt.com/content/over-85-million-spent-covid-19-relief-date-minister-reveals  The executed payments in each program are available here:  http://web.archive.org/web/20200504184149/http://news.gov.tt/content/here-are-some-quick-facts-about-social-support-grants-covid-19-and-how-apply-them

On Friday May 8th, 2020 the Honourable Colm Imbert, Minister of Finance, on behalf of the Government of the Republic of Trinidad and Tobago (GORTT), signed an agreement with the Co-operative Credit Union League of Trinidad and Tobago (CCULTT) and the Central Finance Facility (CFF), for a $100M Government Guaranteed Loan Facility.       The agreement allows Credit Unions which fall under the umbrella bodies of the Co-operative Credit Union League of Trinidad and Tobago (CCULTT) and the Central Finance Facility (CFF), to provide COVID 19 Emergency Income Loans to affected nationals and residents who are members. This follows the initial signing agreement which occurred on Monday April 27th, 2020    http://web.archive.org/web/20200519032331/http://www.news.gov.tt/content/signing-agreement-ccultt-and-cff-100m-government-guaranteed-loan-facility

Health department website states that not everyone with flu-like symptoms will be tested.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200529022714/http://www.health.gov.tt/sitepages/default.aspx?id=305
